It's no surprise that websites that rely on advertising revenue don't particularly like it when people use ad blockers, with plenty of sites throwing up warnings denying you access unless you disable them. Well, now one major streaming service is taking a different approach, as Twitch is reportedly limiting stream resolutions to only 480p if it detects an ad-blocker. Many users of uBlock Origin, an extremely popular browser ad block extension, have confirmed that the service's usual max quality of 1080p at 60 frames per second is no longer available to them. Although some users have unsurprisingly found a way to bypass this restriction, it remains to be seen if this will end up being a permanent change, as Twitch's advertising policies have already drawn the ire of some of its viewers for doing things like injecting ads in the middle of a stream.
